page.title: 08Religion in Saline Fife
page.content: Saline has two churches,one Church of Scotland and one Roman Catholic Church. The Church of Scotland has as it's minister Mr A Downie,who conducts a weekly service at 11.30 am each Sunday morning. He leads a congregation of 400 members. Mr Downie is also minister of the neighbouring Parish Church of Blairingone. The Church offers Sunday School and Bible Class, and supports a Boy's Brigade group. The girls may join the Brownies and Guides. The Young Wives group and Women's Guild also encourage village involvement with the Church. The Roman Catholic Church is a mission station from St Margaret's Church, Dunfermline.
